rationale: This species is restricted to the offshore island of Nosy Be and the basin of the Sambirano River on the adjacent mainland. It is common throughout its range with no known widespread major threats across it's full range. It is assessed as Least Concern.
assessor: Loiselle, P. & participants of the CBSG/ANGAP CAMP "Faune de Madagascar" workshop, Mantasoa, Madagascar 2001
evaluator: Stiassny, M.L.J., Sparks, J.S. (AMNH, New York) & Darwall, W (Freshwater Biodiversity Assessment Programme)
